# Resources

Here is a list of resources that might help you in your R journey:

## Cheat Sheets

* [Base R Cheat Sheet](https://iqss.github.io/dss-workshops/R/Rintro/base-r-cheat-sheet.pdf)
* [RStudio IDE cheatsheet](https://ucdavis-bioinformatics-training.github.io/Oct2017-ILRI-Workshop/Cheat_Sheets/rstudio-IDE-cheatsheet.pdf)
* [Advanced R Cheat Sheet](https://www.rstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/advancedR.pdf)
* [Data Wrangling with dplyr and tidyr Cheat Sheet](https://www.rstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/data-wrangling-cheatsheet.pdf)
* [Work with strings with stringr Cheat Sheet](https://evoldyn.gitlab.io/evomics-2018/ref-sheets/R_strings.pdf)

## Programming Style

* [Google's R Style Guide](https://google.github.io/styleguide/Rguide.html) 

## Other resources

* [R Graph Gallery](https://www.r-graph-gallery.com/) 

## Books

* [R for Data Science](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/)
* [SAS Programming for R Users](https://support.sas.com/content/dam/SAS/support/en/books/free-books/sas-programming-for-r-users.pdf)
